main event: A half-round, yellowish-colored object with a bluish-red top was sighted twice over Seneca Lake, New York on January 29, 1954.
interesting points: The object was spotted at 12 feet off the ground and at 10,900 feet in altitude.
The object exhibited a jerky, evasive flight pattern and a low speed of around 80 mph.
The object emitted a reddish exhaust or flame during its flight.
The object was sighted twice, with the second sighting occurring about 5 minutes after the first.
The report indicates the sighting was consistent with a balloon observation, but does not definitively conclude the object was a balloon.
sighted object: half-round, yellowish-colored object with a bluish-red top
